data.title: News and communications
data.meta_description: Find news and communications from government
data.text:
More support for women experiencing the menopause

Government action to cut the cost of repeatable HRT prescriptions and a new Menopause Taskforce means women experiencing the menopause will be better supported

Updated: 29 October 2021

MHRA publishes clear guidance to support bringing e-cigarettes to market as licensed therapies

The MHRA is committed to responding to the Tobacco Control Plan and supports the UK Governmentâs vision for a smoke-free generation by encouraging safe, high-quality and effective e-cigarette products to be licensed as medicâ¦

Updated: 29 October 2021

Michael Lynton has been reappointed as a Trustee of the Tate

The Prime Minister has reappointed Michael Lynton as a Trustee of the Tate for a term of four years, from 22 June 2021 to 21 June 2025.

Updated: 29 October 2021

Suspension of PGL settings on Ofsted childcare register

Ofsted finds serious safeguarding issues at 4 PGL settings and immediately suspends each of the registrations.

Updated: 29 October 2021

Increased risk of deer collisions as clocks go back

National Highways and British Deer Society warn drivers to be extra vigilant for deer on or near roads after the clocks go back this weekend

Updated: 29 October 2021

Landmark Northern Ireland concert to be screened on Sky Arts and Freeview

Secretary of State for Northern Ireland Brandon Lewis today (Friday 29 Oct) announced that the landmark Live at the Waterfront! concert will be televised on Sky Arts and Freeview on Monday 13 December. The major television dâ¦

Updated: 29 October 2021

CMA letter to NewDay Ltd about 5 breaches of the PPI Order

Letter to NewDay Ltd about its non-compliance with the Payment Protection Insurance (PPI) Market Investigation Order 2011.

Updated: 29 October 2021

Artificial Intelligenceâ¯and IP: Consultation on copyright and patents legislation

The government is today launching aâ¯consultation on how the copyright and patent system should deal withâ¯Artificial Intelligence (AI).

Updated: 29 October 2021

Students urged to take a rapid COVID-19 test before end of half term

The UK Health Security Agency and ministers are calling on young people to make sure they take a rapid COVID-19 test before returning to school after the half term.

Updated: 29 October 2021

Directors disqualified for 17 years for breaching courtâs restrictions

Directors of London scrap metal recycling firm failed to maintain tax payments despite previous court undertaking.

Updated: 29 October 2021

UK to enshrine mandatory climate disclosures for largest companies in law

Firms will be required to disclose climate-related financial information, ensuring they consider the risks and opportunities they face as a result of climate change.

Updated: 29 October 2021

PM call with Polish Prime Minister Mateus Morawiecki: 29 October 2021

Prime Minister Boris Johnson spoke to Polish Prime Minister Mateus Morawiecki ahead of next weekâs COP26 Summit.

Updated: 29 October 2021

Government announces support for rough sleepers over winter

Â£66 million funding will provide safe and warm accommodation over winter.

Updated: 29 October 2021

New directors appointed to the Animal Health and Welfare Board for England

Biosecurity Minister Lord Benyon has appointed six new members to the Animal Health and Welfare Board for England

Updated: 29 October 2021

UK Hydrographic Office 2020-2021 Annual Report released

The UKHO's Annual Report and Accounts for 2020 to 2021 is available to view and download

Updated: 29 October 2021

CoRWM plenary meeting dates and locations

Details of our plenary meetings (all open to the public) for 2021 to 2022.

Updated: 29 October 2021

The Queen Elizabeth II bridge at Dartford celebrates 30 years of connecting Essex and Kent

The Queen Elizabeth II bridge at Dartford, which has played crucial role on the M25 motorway by connecting communities in Essex and Kent, celebrates 30 years of uniting road users this weekend.

Updated: 29 October 2021

Better broadband for 500,000 rural homes in UK gigabit revolution

More than 500,000 more rural homes and businesses will be given access to better broadband under plans to level up the UK with improved internet connectivity.

Updated: 29 October 2021

Achieving Net Zero: The Crucial Role of Business

The UK brings together Taiwan business to discuss the need for greater emissions reduction and committing to Net Zero

Updated: 29 October 2021
